annotations.description: It was an attractive offensive game and the fans have no reason to be upset. Bayern Munich were better today and displayed masterful control and movement. The visitors couldn't keep pace with the hosts, who excelled in virtually every aspect of the game. They fully deserved their win.

That was close by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.

annotations.description: Substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) replaces Douglas Costa.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes a direct free kick.

Adam Hlousek (VfB Stuttgart) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. Bayern Munich win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Przemyslaw Tyton thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.

Manuel Neuer pulls off a great save to deny Philip Heise (VfB Stuttgart) after receiving a precise defence splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayern Munich.
Referee Bastian Dankert sees the trip by Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. A free kick has been awarded to Bayern Munich.
Przemyslaw Tyton pulls off a great save to deny Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the left side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Referee Bastian Dankert blows his whistle to start the second half.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has already been more to see prior to the half time break than there is in most games during the full 90 minutes. It was a fairly one sided opening 45 minutes, with Bayern Munich much the better side better so far. The visitors have been very flat and lacked creativity in their attack. Let's see if they change something in the second period.

Przemyslaw Tyton hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.

annotations.label: soccer-ball

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Przemyslaw Tyton, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Filip Kostic (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Great teamplay by Bayern Munich as they control the ball with a lot of short passes. Patience is the key if they want to find a gap in the defence to score.

Hello, welcome to our live play by play commentaries. You will be able to see a written form of all the interesting moments of the game, so you won't miss a thing. Sit back and have fun.

It was an attractive offensive game and the fans have no reason to be upset. Bayern Munich were better today and displayed masterful control and movement. The visitors couldn't keep pace with the hosts, who excelled in virtually every aspect of the game. They fully deserved their win.
